contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|tango}} '''[[Tango]]''' is a social dance form including Argentine, Uruguayan, and international ballroom tango. '''Tango''' may also refer to: *[[Argentine tango]], a social dance form, the original form of tango *[[Brazilian tango]], a dance, with its accompanying music, that originated in the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro *[[Tango (music)]], a genre of music that originated in Argentina and Uruguay *[[Tango (flamenco)]], a song-form or instrumental-form of flamenco music '''TANGO''' may also refer to: *The letter T in the [[NATO phonetic alphabet]] **and therefore, soldiers may use "Tango" as their slang for an enemy (T)arget *A variety of lettuce (''Lactuca sativa var tango'') {{tocright}} == Works of music == *[[Tango in D]], composition by Isaac Albéniz *[[Tango (Patty Larkin album)|''Tango'' (Patty Larkin album)]], 1991 *[[Tango (Julio Iglesias album)|''Tango'' (Julio Iglesias album)]], 1996 *[[Tango (Sonia & Disappear Fear album)|''Tango'' (Sonia & Disappear Fear album)]], 2007 *"Tango", a song on the 2006 album, ''[[Public Warning]]'' by Lady Sovereign *[[Tango (Negative album)|''Tango'' (Negative album)]] **[[Tango (song)|"Tango" (song)]], the title track *[[Tango (Stravinsky)]], a 1940 piece originally composed for piano by Russian composer Igor Stravinsky == Film == *''¡Tango!'' (1933 film), a film by Argentine director [[Luis Moglia Barth]] *''Tango'' (1933 film), a film by Danish director [[George Schnéevoigt]] *[[Tango (1969 film)|''Tango'' (1969 film)]], a 1969 Bulgarian film *''Tango'' (1980 film), an animated film by Polish director [[Zbigniew Rybczyński]] *''Tango'' (1993 film), a film by French director [[Patrice Leconte]] *[[Tango (1998 film)|''Tango'' (1998 film)]], a film by Spanish director Carlos Saura == Organisations and companies == *[[Tango (telecom)]], a mobile telephone operator in Luxembourg and Liechtenstein *[[T.TV]], a television channel in Luxembourg formerly known as Tango TV *[[TV6 (Lithuania)]], also known as Tango TV in Lithuania *[[Command Post Tango]], a U.S. military installation in South Korea == People == *[[Tanguito]] (1945–1972), a.k.a. Tango, Argentine singer-songwriter *[[Tom Tango]], sabermetrician == Performing arts == *[[Tango (Balanchine)|''Tango'' (Balanchine)]], a ballet by George Balanchine based on a Stravinsky composition *[[Tango (Martins)|''Tango'' (Martins)]], a ballet by Peter Martins based on a Stravinsky composition *''Tango'', a 1964 play by [[Sławomir Mrożek]] == Places == *[[Tango Province]], Japan, an old province in today's northern Kyoto Prefecture *Tango, a neighborhood in [[Glan, Sarangani]], Philippines *[[Tangov]], Azerbaijan *[[Tango Monastery]], near Thimphu, Bhutan == Publishing == *''[[Tango Magazine]]'', a U.S. magazine for adult women under 40 *[[Tango (comics)|''Tango'' (comics)]], a comics anthology published in Australia since 1997 == Software == *[[Tango (tax software)]], a tax software application from H&R Block *[[Dalim Tango]], Dalim's product for colour retouching during the 1990s *[[TANGO]] a CORBA based control system worked on by various European institutions *Tango PCB and Tango Schematic, early [[Computer-aided engineering]] programs *[[Tango Desktop Project]] *[[Tango (application)]], a video-messaging application software == Transport == *[[Tango (boat)]], also known as the Armored Troop Carrier, used in the Vietnam War *[[Tango-class submarine|''Tango'' class submarine]] is the NATO code name for the Russian ''Project 641B Som'' submarine class *[[Tango (tram)]], a tram type produced by Stadler Rail *[[Commuter Cars Tango]], an electric vehicle manufactured in Spokane, Washington, USA *[[SEAT Tango]], a roadster concept car built by the Spanish car maker SEAT *[[Japanese battleship Tango|Japanese battleship ''Tango'']], a pre-dreadnought battleship originally known as the Poltava == Other uses == *[[Tango (drink)]], a soft drink manufactured in the United Kingdom *[[Adidas Tango]], a type of football designed by Adidas *[[Air Canada Tango]], a defunct low-cost airline launched by Air Canada *[[Tango 01]], the call sign of the Boeing 757 presidential aircraft in Argentinas Agrupación Aérea Presidencial *[[Cluster II (spacecraft)]], also known as Cluster 4, an ESA satellite *[[Prisma]], a satellite owned by the Swedish Space Corporation *[[Black Knights' Tango]], a chess opening *[[Tango (mythology)]], the third child of the primordial mother goddess, Varima-te-takere == See also == *[[Tangos (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
